Row.Text: Poppin' Party
Poppin' Party
PPP's
Star Beat

[ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration provides an additional 10% [ICON_Culture] Culture. Gain a [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic when triggering the first [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration. Relics provide +3 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Each Civic researched provides 10% progress towards "Early Empire" and "Political Philosophy". Campuses, Theater Squares, and Holy Sites adjacent to [ICON_RESOURCE_ANTIQUITY_SITE][ICON_RESOURCE_SHIPWRECK] Artifact tiles gain +4 adjacency bonus.

Founder of Poppin'

All cities receive Random Star for free. Civilian units ignore all civilization borders, but your borders are permanently open. Gain one [ICON_Government] Wildcard policy slot upon unlocking "Political Philosophy". Founding a city provides 1 [ICON_Envoy] Envoy, and cities with Random Star provide an additional [ICON_Envoy] Envoy after building a Diplomatic Quarter and unlocking "Diplomatic Service". Each suzerained city-state provides +5% [ICON_Production] Production, +5% [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +5% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism to your civilization. Can conduct a series of unique projects "Twinkle Twinkle".[NEWLINE](With "New Adjacency Core" enabled) Gain +1 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet point in city centres for each civilization met; Cities, Government Plaza and Diplomatic Quarter gains [ICON_InfluencePerTurn] Influence based on followers of your religion in each city centre.
Warehouse Master

Unlock "Irrigation" immediately after unlocking "Code of Laws". Plantations and Farms improving bonus resources provide +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture; if the tile has fresh water, also +2 [ICON_Production] Production. All Great Works provide +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold base; Great Work yields increased by 200%. Has unique building "Ryuseido".[NEWLINE]Gain the following spy-related bonuses: Gain two Spies upon unlocking "Writing", Spy capacity +1 for each Campus or Commercial Hub built. Spies deploy instantly, receive one free [ICON_Promotion] promotion, and come with "Technician" promotion. Steal Technology operations always unlock the corresponding technology.
Hanazono LAND

Non-[ICON_Food] Food Amenity bonuses increased by 50%. Pastures and Camps provide +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent Preserves. For each improved Pasture/Camp resource, all cities gain +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities. Gain a Naturalist when founding your Capital. Appeal of all tiles +2; cities with National Parks gain additional +3 Appeal. Cities with National Parks gain 2 points per turn of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person points provided by Holy Sites, Campuses, and Preserves. When creating a National Park, strategic resource tiles within it provide 15 stockpile and [ICON_Science] Science per tile; bonus and luxury resources provide [ICON_Culture] Culture. Has unique unit "Rabbit Brigade".[NEWLINE](With "New Adjacency Core" enabled) Preserves provide strategic resources based on city [ICON_Amenities] Amenity surplus, Holy Sites provide [ICON_Science] Science based on total Appeal of adjacent tiles; both bonuses increses with the sum of national parks built.
Aroma of the Bakery

Cities receive a Granary when they have Random Star. First-tier Neighborhood buildings provide +2 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. Bonus resources provide +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +2 [ICON_Production] Production; Wheat provides additional +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Each Farm in the destination city provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.[ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes exert +100% [ICON_Religion] Religious Pressure. Has unique district "Shopping Street".[NEWLINE](With "Light Industrial Zone" enabled) Unique district changes from "Shopping Street" to "Yamabuki Bakery".[NEWLINE](With "Monopolies and Corporations" enabled) Granaries provide +3 Product slots. Can conduct project "Bake Bread".
Chocolate Cornet Panic

Has unique Governor "Yuri Ushigome" and unique unbuildable unit "Rimi's Zombie". Start the game with two [ICON_Governor] Governor titles. Gain two Rimi's Zombies when founding Capital/founding city on foreign continent; gain two when capturing a city, plus two more if it's foreign religion city; gain one when recruiting Great People, plus one if it's [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet or [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician. Gain two copies of unique luxury "Chocolate Cornet" when founding Capital or conquering foreign religion city. Inquisitors can completely remove foreign religion.
Inheritor

Poppin' Party unique unit, replacing Swordsman. Unlocked at "Political Philosophy", with higher base [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and [ICON_Movement] Movement, no strategic resource cost. Generates a Relic upon killing a unit or being killed.
Random Star
Poppin' Party unique building, replacing Monument with lower base cost. Provides extra +1 [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician point and 2 slots for Great Works of any type.
Twinkle Twinkle Little Star
Twinkle Twinkle Little Star
Kasumi's unique project, requires 'Early Empire'. Gain some Founder Belief bonuses.
How I Wonder What You Are
How I Wonder What You Are
Kasumi's unique project, requires 'Divine Right' and 'Twinkle Twinkle Little Star'. Upon completion, gain all Follower Belief bonuses.
Up Above the World So High
Up Above the World So High
Kasumi's unique project, requires 'Divine Right' and 'Twinkle Twinkle Little Star'. Upon completion, gain all Enhancer Belief bonuses.
Like a Diamond in the Sky
Like a Diamond in the Sky
Kasumi's unique project. Upon completion, gain all Pantheon bonuses.
Ryuseido
Arisa's unique building, replacing Market. +1 [ICON_Science] Science per era. Yields extend to cities within 6 tiles (each city affected once). Provides 3 Great Work slots.
Theming bonus tripled when displaying works of the same type.
Rabbit Brigade

Tae's unique Light Cavalry unit, unlocked at "Animal Husbandry", can build 3 National Parks. Gain [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonuses upon unlocking specific technologies: +37 when unlocking "Stirrups", +14 at "Scientific Theory", +21 at "Sanitation", +10 at "Replaceable Parts". Gain +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement upon unlocking "Divine Right", +2 Sight at "Humanism", heal when attacking after unlocking "Natural History", capture defeated units as Rabbit Brigade after unlocking "Conservation".
Shopping Street

Saaya's unique district, replacing Neighborhood, unlocked at "Medieval Faires" with lower base cost. Default +3 Housing. +2 Housing and +1 Food, +1 Gold when adjacent to City Center; +2 Gold when adjacent to Commercial Hub or Entertainment Complex; +2 Housing, +2 Food, +1 Gold when adjacent to other Shopping Streets. Provides 3 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity and 3 Traders upon first completion.
Yamabuki Bakery

Saaya's unique district, replacing Light Industrial Zone, with lower base cost. Multiple can be built in one city. +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to adjacent districts; provides major adjacency bonuses to Campus, Theater Square, Holy Site, Industrial Zone, and Aerodrome. +8% [ICON_Production] Production when city produces projects.
Bake Bread
Bake Bread
Saaya's unique project, requires improved Wheat resource in territory. Upon completion, provides one [ICON_GreatWork_Product] unique Product.
Rimi's Zombie
Rimi's unique unit, cannot be built or purchased, able to capture enemy military units. Gains [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when killing units, being killed, or when Rimi's ranged units kill units.
Yuri Ushigome
Rimi's Elder Sister
Rimi's Elder Sister
Rimi's Elder Sister
Yamabuki Brand Bread
Yamabuki Bakery
Saaya's Bread
Chocolate Cornet
Original Band
Unlock Holy Site when any Ancient Era technology is researched. +100% [ICON_Production] Production towards Holy Site construction. This city receives Random Star for free.
Overseas Study

Provides 2 [ICON_Envoy] Envoys when assigned to a city-state. Campus in this city gains +100% [ICON_Science] Science adjacency bonus. All Holy Sites in your civilization provide [ICON_Science] Science equal to their [ICON_Faith] Faith adjacency bonus.
Companionship
Provides 2 Chocolate Cornets to the established city. Rimi's Zombie +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement.
Diligent Study
The established city can build one extra [ICON_District] district. +3 [ICON_Science] Science per district in this city. All cities on foreign continents provide +25% [ICON_Science] Science.
Rolling On
Allows purchasing Rimi's Zombie with [ICON_Faith] Faith, and gain an extra Zombie when produced.
Reunion
Rimi's Zombie can capture enemy military units as rock bands. Rock Bands generate +150% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism during peace.
Glitter☆Green
Glitter☆Green
Don't Be Afraid
Glee! Glee! Glee!
{1_Amount}% chance to capture enemy units.
Previous kills provide +{Property} [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.
Companionship
+2 [ICON_Movement] Movement.
Reunion
Can capture enemy units as Rock Bands
Power of Inheritance
Gain 1 [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic when killing enemy units.
Power of Inheritance
Generate 1 [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic when killed.

+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending while adjacent to Glitter☆Green

[ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from this city to other civilizations provide +3 [ICON_Food] Food to them.[NEWLINE]International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from this city provide +5 [ICON_Gold] Gold.[NEWLINE]City gains +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Production] production from adjacent Yamabuki Bakery.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Science] science from adjacent Yamabuki Bakery.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Faith] faith from adjacent Yamabuki Bakery.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Culture] culture from adjacent Yamabuki Bakery.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Production] production from adjacent Yamabuki Bakery.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Gold] gold from adjacent Yamabuki Bakery.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Food] food from adjacent city center.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Gold] gold from adjacent city center.

+{1_Num} [ICON_Gold] gold from adjacent entertainment complex.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Gold] gold from adjacent shopping street.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Food] food from adjacent shopping street.
+{1_iBonus} {2_YieldIcon} from the {3_AdjacentSubjectNum} Civilizations you've met.
+{1_iBonus} {2_YieldIcon} from the {3_AdjacentSubjectNum} National Parks you've built.
Striking shiny, heart-pounding![NEWLINE](Kira kira, doki doki!)
Really... why are you telling me this?
It's so sad to eat rabbits, I can't do it.
Using a rolling pin as drumsticks? Just kidding!
It's okay, chocolate cornets go to a separate stomach~

Kasumi Toyama, the celebrated "Founder", soul of the great girl band era! Following the starlight in your heart, you boldly forge ahead, uniting companions to reignite musical dreams. But real stories aren't just about harmony—they encompass sudden changes in daily life and new worldviews awaiting your exploration. Wherever you go, your influence spreads like fragrance along an ancient path.

Arisa Ichigaya, bidding farewell to Tonegawa, returns to dreams and welcomes a shining star. Your expertise in bonsai, academics, and warehouse management is undeniable—but did you recall piano days rewarded by star stickers while honing those skills? Fortunately, new friendships rekindled lost passions. Now all know behind your sharp tongue lies warmth, like filled chocolates enhancing perfection.

Tae Hanazono, the purest guitar hero, crossing intersections of solitude and bustle, adorning tomorrows with serendipitous whimsy. Every rabbit's movement reveals mysteries; you coexist with them, striving to build a lush Hanazono LAND. In this mutual journey, you grasp profound rhetoric philosophy. Guard the sanctuary with rabbits, defend friendships with bandmates, unleash resonance with nature.

Maillard's sweet aroma leaps through streets, bakery lights glow before queues reach. Saaya Yamabuki, while band girls joyfully devour bread, your musical dream breaks free from family duties, returning behind the drum kit. This world brims with opportunities and stages; balancing both is profound, but you, seasoned from early responsibility, have mastered the art. Roll the world, drumstick by drumstick.

Rimi Ushigome, synonymous with chocolate cornets—yet humans are multidimensional, embracing horror films, Kansai charm, and ninja dreams. Growth means shedding habitual dependence, standing firm without fear of loss. Facing past and future filled with partings, how you overcame challenges with friends' hands before, now demands united resolve to shape your destiny!
Mainly performing at Livehouse Circle, but Space, Ring, etc., also witness the band's growth.
LOVING EVERYone!
5 members (not including "sixth" members like Rokka Asahi)
Ryuseido, where Kasumi obtained Random Star (and more importantly, Arisa)
キラキラ、ドキドキ！[NEWLINE](Kira kira, doki doki!)
Really... why are you telling me this?
It's so sad to eat rabbits, I can't do it.
Using a rolling pin as drumsticks? Just kidding!
It's okay, chocolate cornets go to a separate stomach♪(´▽｀)

As the guitarist and vocalist, Kasumi Toyama had always been searching for something that sparkled and made her heart race, like the "Star's Pulse" she heard while stargazing as a child. This led to the formation of the band. Though their skills needed improvement and experience was lacking, the members—besides Kasumi, included Tae Hanazono who loved music, Rimi Ushigome who wanted to overcome her negative traits, gentle and family-oriented Saaya Yamabuki, and contradictory yet sincere Arisa Ichigaya—poured their feelings into music. This shining five-member high school girl band in the era of girl bands sings daily to convey more heart-fluttering moments.

Kasumi Toyama, leader, vocalist, rhythm guitarist, and lyricist of Poppin' Party, also the main protagonist of BanG Dream! series. As a child camping, she and her sister Asuka heard the Star's Pulse, leading her to constantly seek sparkling, heart-throbbing things (Kasumi-speak), ultimately founding Poppin' Party.
Loves adventure and karaoke. Favorite foods: french fries, white rice; hates natto. Has unique "Kasumi-speak" vocabulary.
Impulsive, outgoing enough to befriend all girls, but afraid of ghosts; hairstyle shaped like two-pointed star, but afraid of flying.

From tracking Arisa's sticker to Ryuseido, gathering bandmates, honing guitar skills, filling in for Glitter☆Green to sing "Twinkle Twinkle," and finally reaching Budokan—she gained friendships (and more) while pioneering an entire era of girl bands.
(Collated from Fandom, Moegirl Encyclopedia)
Arisa Ichigaya, keyboardist of Poppin'Party, contemporary tsundere icon, widely recognized as Kasumi's soulmate. Currently serves as vice-president of Hanasakigawa Girls' School student council.
Granddaughter of the pawnshop "Ryuseido" family. Indoor enthusiast with bonsai and internet as hobbies, rarely goes out but excels at盆栽 and academics due to good education.
Learned piano as child, outstanding performer who earned most star stickers, but abandoned instrument for studies until meeting Kasumi reignited her musical sense.
Very sarcastic, band's exclusive critic, especially harsh towards Kasumi; but merely struggles with honesty. Sold beloved盆栽 to buy synthesizer.
(Collated from Moegirl Encyclopedia)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Really... why are you telling me this?[NEWLINE]Nothing, just citing sources.
Lead guitarist of Poppin' Party, music-loving powerhouse, started learning guitar in elementary school, works at LiveHouse in high school. Nickname "Otae" (not "Otea").
Obsessed with rabbits (Bunnies so cute, how can you eat bunnies). Keeps twenty rabbits as family, naming each and knowing their traits. Once stated dream is to live on rabbit-filled island.
Appears serious but thinks on different wavelength—"natural/denpa type." Often links real scenes to rabbits, even encountering magical creatures.
Loves hamburger steak, always recommends when asked about food, yet not picky—eats anything.
Was scouted by Chu² for RAISE A SUILEN but declined to abandon Poppin' Party, ultimately returning.[NEWLINE](From Moegirl Encyclopedia)
Drummer of Poppin' Party, face of Yamabuki Bakery. Balances work and study, helping at bakery while attending high school, renowned throughout shopping district.

Formed band CHiSPA in middle school with Natsuki Uno, Mayu Kawabata, Bunka Mori, but debut Live interrupted by mother's hospitalization; later quit band fearing mother's health and burdening members. Inspired by Kasumi, resumed band life and reconciled with CHiSPA friends.
Gentle personality, caring for friends, Kasumi's confidante. Has younger siblings to care for.
Yamabuki Bakery may be BanG Dream!'s top eatery. Its chocolate cornets, Rimi devours endlessly; Moca Aoba consumes with iron stomach; Kasumi sniffs Saaya for new bread scents.
(Collated from Moegirl Encyclopedia)
Rimi Ushigome, bassist of Poppin' Party. From Kansai, occasionally slips into dialect.

Loves chocolate cornets, especially Yamabuki Bakery's, claims "separate stomach for chocolate cornet." Chocolate cornets thread through Rimi's life, becoming her symbol. Also loves meat and fresh cream.
Timid, shy personality. Ironically obsessed with horror films.

Learned bass from sister Yuri Ushigome, using her inherited bass. Filling in for delayed Yuri, Rimi performed with Kasumi on bass, successfully meeting Glitter☆Green for upgraded "Twinkle Twinkle," overcoming timidity to join band.
(Collated from Moegirl Encyclopedia)
Random Star, Kasumi's guitar shaped like shooting star. Originally lying in Arisa's warehouse awaiting auction, it was preserved by Kasumi's moving persistence, becoming her main instrument.
Ryuseido, Arisa's family-run pawnshop, where Poppin' Party often rehearses.

In BanG Dream!'s original concept, Random Star was Arisa's father's memento. His band disbanded before debut when drummer died unexpectedly; he abandoned music, married into pawnshop. Every year on father's memorial, Arisa displayed Random Star in shop window with star/arrow markings, hoping to guide someone special here.
Tae Hanazono has twenty rabbits at home; she once suggested bringing them onstage to enhance performances.

Rimi loves horror films, where Zombies are key subgenre, blending Eastern folklore for unique variations. Hong Kong's "Taoist Exorcism" series was pan-Chinese hit; Japan's "The Ring" TV-crawling ghost Sadako became cultural icon.

Shopping Street gathers band girls; Poppin'Party and Afterglow perform at events here. Modeled after Edogawabashi Jizodori Shopping Street.[NEWLINE]Features: Yamabuki Bakery (Saaya), Hazawa Cafe (Tsugumi, Eve, Chisato, Taki), Kitazawa Meat Shop (Hagumi), public bath "Asahi-yu" (Rokka), Live House Galaxy (Rokka, Masuki), Milky Way Produce (Masuki), and mascot Michelle (Misaki).
Yamabuki Bakery, run by Yamabuki family, is a famous shop on Shopping Street. Products beloved by all—see "Leader" section for Saaya chapter.

Glitter*Green is a band appearing in "BanG Dream!" and its derivative works, though the voice actors for the characters do not actually play instruments. They serve as the Horatio to BanG Dream! - the foundational witnesses who introduce the worldview before yielding the stage.

Commonly known as グリグリ (guriguri), they are also written as Glitter☆Green. Making their debut in the first season of the anime, they are a band formed by upperclassmen at Kasumi's school who enjoy significant popularity among peers.
The band consists of Yuri Ushigome (Gt. Vo.), Rī Ujikawa (Ba.), Nanami Wanibe (Key.), and Hinako Hatori (Dr.).
All character voice actors are members of Milky Holmes, the voice actress unit from "Detective Opera Milky Holmes".
Heart-Throbbing
Likes all civilizations by default, but hates those attacking her allies.
I-It's Not Like I Like You
Likes high-science civilizations, hates those overexploiting land.
Natural Beauty
Likes high-population civilizations, hates those pillaging others.
Housekeeper's Resolve
Likes high-income civilizations, hates wealthy warmongers.
Heart of Chocolate Cornet
Likes civilizations not converting her, hates religious aggressors.
You're really gerigeri-chu, super da-wa╰(☆o☆)╯
Our friends are not to be harmed!
She likes all civilizations.
She hates civilizations harming her allies.
Let's all sparkle and pulse together!
Sorry...
Let's search for the world's stars together!
Let's all sparkle and pulse together!
Sorry...
Against destroyers of the girl band worldview—fists out, attack!
Against destroyers of the girl band worldview—fists out, attack!
Dreams... can't even shout slogans anymore...
Dreams... can't even shout slogans anymore...
Wow, what a GIFT with jingling soul of stars! Thank you~
Eeeeh, this gadget might not come to my need...
Ta-dah! Our delegation brings a 1:1 replica of Random Star, polished sparkling shiny—with Popipa autographs!
Huh? Wait wait wait...
Huh? Wait wait wait...
Ya-hoo~ I'm Kasumi Toyama—oh, oh, oh, your eyes have the Star's Pulse!
Since you're here, come see our rehearsal spot! I have ten thousand ways to get Arisa to... hehe
Great success, Lu☆cky!
Perfect time for introductions! When I looked up at stars as a kid, I heard the Star's Pulse...
Ooh, what a coincidence!
Yeayyy, starry feeling!
Wh-what's this?
Yay, everyone coming for hugs? Here I—ahh ahh—
Hmph, barely deserve a "not bad." Next time won't be so easy!
Ugh, flowers aren't for you to ruin!
She likes civilizations with high science output.
She's displeased with your destructive development.
Wha- I haven't... haven't acknowledged you... Fine, I admit it (blushing)
I-It's not like I like you!
Seems there's another person I'll need to rack my brains to surprise...
Eh? D-Don't get so excited!
No! Let me emphasize - NO!
Damn it, at this point I absolutely can't tolerate this anymore!
Damn it, at this point I absolutely can't tolerate this anymore!
I never said "surrender," I-I was just temporarily— Shut up! Ugh, that's not what I meant...
I never said "surrender," I-I was just temporarily— Shut up! Ugh, that's not what I meant...
Well, anyway, th-thank you! (blushing)
No—way—!
Here's a newly potted fir tree we grew—it's taking up space anyway, you can have it[NEWLINE]—if you let it die, I won't be polite!
How outrageous!!!
How outrageous!!!
I'm Arisa Ichigaya... Though... though someone forced me into the next part... Anyway, I play keyboards in Poppin' Party, thanks!
I usually stay at Ryuseido... What? That's not a place for random people! What, you're not random... Hmm...
I never said I wanted to come... Ah, fine, it's just embarrassing...
Fine, I'll tell you secretly; promise me today's conversation stays confidential!
Eh? *cough* Nice weather today.
Seriously, are you waiting for me to praise you...?
Hmph, I r-really don't like you!
Ah? What are you trying to do? Stay away from me, you're so noisy!
Your land is as lively as when my twenty rabbits dig simultaneously, so adorable~
If you keep destroying like this, a nation's right to obtain delicious hamburgers and rabbit feed through agriculture will be ruined by you...
She likes civilizations with large populations.
She hates civilizations that plunder others' territories.
Feels like even ten O-chan couldn't outrun me tomorrow!
Hmm mm, not possible~ Look, even Shi-chan is shaking her head!
From now on—not tomorrow—when I find an island full of rabbits, I'll invite you to join!
Feels like even ten O-chan couldn't outrun me tomorrow!
Hmm mm, not possible~ Look, even Shi-chan is shaking her head!
Eh? Your troops' hair is messier than tangled cables; but this time, I won't provide any combs!
Today, I carefully cleaned my guitar, changed strings, searched my mental music library—just to righteously conquer you!
Really... going somewhere far away? Without even becoming a grandma playing in a band? Goodbye O-chan, maybe I really did "set you on the treadmill"...
Really... going somewhere far away? Without even becoming a grandma playing in a band? Goodbye O-chan, maybe I really did "set you on the treadmill"...
Your delegation excites me like my rabbits chewing carrots!
O-chan agrees with me, today's not good for visitors.
Our delegation includes my beloved Shiro. It performs "meat hoop jumps"—jumping through hamburger patties with only the rims left. How to have a burger rim? Shiro doesn't eat meat~
Feedback without a guitar? You...
Feedback without a guitar? You...
I'm Tae Hanazono~ Rabbit chew toys have gotten expensive lately... Oh, not advertising!
Want to see our city? Its borders look like countless running rabbits...
Wonder if your nation appreciates hamburgers with eggs too?
Take my guitar pick. Guitar picks are like rabbit teeth—endless supply!
Good morning~ Here are greetings from the rabbits: Morning, morning,... (repeat ×20)
My secret trick: playing "Initial" to veggie leaves helps rabbits absorb vitamins.
I can't get no satisfaction, I wanna paint everything black. Gimme shelter, been walkin' in Central Park...
Cornered rabbits bite, let alone me protecting them... Showdown time!
Profitability is an art. I've learned much from your steadfastness.
Wealth without virtue not only betrays family admiration but spreads disaster.
She favors civilizations with high income.
She despises wealthy civilizations that declare surprise wars on others.
With your help, bakery business and band schedules won't be problems anymore!
Sorry, while I yearn for it, considering family and band duties, I must decline.
Perhaps young love isn't heartfelt but eye-driven. No matter, ours is soul-to-soul.
With your help, bakery business and band schedules won't be problems anymore!
Sorry, while I yearn for it, considering family and band duties, I must decline.
Fire-breathing behind drums may be unrealistic, but unleashing fury against your aggression... worth it.
Fire-breathing behind drums may be unrealistic, but unleashing fury against your aggression... worth it.
Ahaha... words fail. Sana and Jun are young, Kasumi knows nothing... Spare them...
Ahaha... words fail. Sana and Jun are young, Kasumi knows nothing... Spare them...
Your gift is so thoughtful!
Band practice today, need to prepare tomorrow's bread, apologies.
Honored to introduce Yamabuki Bakery classics: chocolate cornets and melon bread. Also new items like "Poppin' Bread"—a meal-like bread set.
Ahaha...
Ahaha...
Saaya Yamabuki greets you! Eaten right?
Hungry? Our city's nearby—come visit for fresh-baked bread! Any variety~
Actually came to buy premium flour... Getting scarcer nowadays...
Time's tight—our meeting story must be brief; let's exchange understanding for lasting connection.
(From afar) Hello————want some bread————?
Your courage facing life is what I long lacked.
Oh! Kasumi emergency call! Must go.
Sorry, bakery's closed. "Just here for bread" won't cut it!
Next time, try our chocolate cornets! Preferably Yamabuki Bakery's!
Ser-seriously, I'll never tire of chocolate cornets!
You respected Rimi's beliefs.
Rimi resents you imposing beliefs upon her.
Hard finding friends these days. Besides Popipa, you're number one!
Sorry, still learning to say no.
Amazing meeting someone who shares all my interests!
Hard finding friends these days. Besides Popipa, you're number one!~
Sorry, still learning to say no.
Seen grotesque evils in horror films, but your mediocre shamelessness... unprecedented.
Seen grotesque evils in horror films, but your mediocre shamelessness... unprecedented.
Thought I'd known sorrow, but this time... no chance to find partners or overcome challenges...
Thought I'd known sorrow, but this time... no chance to find partners or overcome challenges...
Well, thanks for caring!
Could've chatted about chocolate...
Our delegation brings exotic chocolates—Venezuela to Ghana! Plus Yamabuki's signature chocolate cornets. You'll love them!
Not cool...
Not cool...
